name: Ponytail Palm
description: Family: Asparagaceae Origin: Eastern Mexico Growth Habit: Slow-growing, succulent-like tree with a swollen base and long, arching leaves Light Required: Bright, indirect sunlight Water Required: Low; allow soil to dry out between waterings Soil Condition: Well-draining, sandy or cactus mix Uses: Ornamental indoor/outdoor plant, drought-tolerant landscapes, bonsai

name: Blue Cactus
description: Family: Cactaceae Origin: Tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas (Brazil, Caribbean, Mexico) Growth Habit: Columnar, tree-like cactus with striking bluish-green stems and golden spines Light Required: Full sun Water Required: Low; water sparingly and allow soil to dry out between waterings Soil Condition: Well-draining, sandy or cactus mix Uses: Ornamental plant, xeriscaping, container gardening, desert-themed landscapes

name: Totem Pole Cactus
description: Family: Cactaceae Origin: Sonoran Desert, Northern Mexico and Southern Arizona Growth Habit: Tall, columnar cactus; often spineless with smooth, bumpy surface (monstrose form) Light Required: Full sun Water Required: Low; drought-tolerant, water sparingly Soil Condition: Well-draining, sandy or cactus mix Uses: Ornamental plant, xeriscaping, desert gardens, container cultivation

name: Buddha Belly Plant
description: Family: Euphorbiaceae Origin: Central America Growth Habit: Succulent shrub with a swollen caudex and large lobed leaves Light Required: Bright, indirect light to full sun Water Required: Moderate; water when soil is dry Soil Condition: Well-draining soil Uses: Ornamental indoor/outdoor plant, medicinal uses (toxic)

name: Crested Cat Tail Euphorbia
description: Family: Euphorbiaceae Origin: Madagascar Growth Habit: Crested form with sculptural, fan-like growth on cylindrical stems Light Required: Bright light to full sun Water Required: Low; drought-tolerant Soil Condition: Well-draining cactus or succulent mix Uses: Decorative plant for collectors, xeriscaping, container gardens

name: Crested Euphorbia
description: Family: Euphorbiaceae Origin: India Growth Habit: Fan-shaped, crested form often grafted onto Euphorbia rootstock Light Required: Bright indirect light to partial sun Water Required: Low; water sparingly Soil Condition: Well-draining soil Uses: Unique ornamental plant, grown in containers or as grafted specimen

name: Golden Barrel Cactus
description: Family: Cactaceae Origin: Mexico Growth Habit: Round, barrel-shaped cactus with prominent ribs and golden spines Light Required: Full sun Water Required: Low; water only when soil is dry Soil Condition: Well-draining, sandy or gritty soil Uses: Rock gardens, desert landscapes, containers

name: Ball Cactus
description: Family: Cactaceae Origin: Southern Brazil, Uruguay Growth Habit: Globular to short columnar cactus with ribs and yellow spines Light Required: Bright light to full sun Water Required: Moderate; allow soil to dry between watering Soil Condition: Well-draining cactus mix Uses: Decorative cactus for pots or succulent arrangements

name: Barrel Cactus
description: Family: Cactaceae Origin: Southwestern U.S. and Mexico Growth Habit: Large barrel-shaped cactus with heavy ribs and prominent spines Light Required: Full sun Water Required: Low; drought-tolerant Soil Condition: Sandy, well-draining soil Uses: Landscape feature in arid gardens, containers, erosion control
